segment.source: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals shows how to create an AppLocker rule with a file hash condition.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals shows how to create an AppLocker rule with a file hash condition.

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals shows how to create an AppLocker rule with a file hash condition.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals shows how to create an AppLocker rule with a file hash condition.

segment.source: File hash rules use a system-computed cryptographic hash of the identified file.
segment.target: File hash rules use a system-computed cryptographic hash of the identified file.

segment.source: For info about the file hash condition, see Understanding the File Hash Rule Condition in AppLocker.
segment.target: For info about the file hash condition, see Understanding the File Hash Rule Condition in AppLocker.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.

segment.source: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: To create a new rule with a file hash condition
segment.target: To create a new rule with a file hash condition

segment.source: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the rule collection that you want to create the rule for.
segment.target: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the rule collection that you want to create the rule for.

segment.source: On the Action menu, click Create New Rule.
segment.target: On the Action menu, click Create New Rule.

segment.source: On the Before You Begin page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Before You Begin page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Permissions page, select the action (allow or deny) and the user or group that the rule should apply to, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Permissions page, select the action (allow or deny) and the user or group that the rule should apply to, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Conditions page, select the File hash rule condition, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Conditions page, select the File hash rule condition, and then click Next.

segment.source: Browse Files to locate the targeted application file.
segment.target: Browse Files to locate the targeted application file.

segment.source: Note: You can also click Browse Folders which calculates the hash for all the appropriate files relative to the rule collection.
segment.target: Note: You can also click Browse Folders which calculates the hash for all the appropriate files relative to the rule collection.

segment.source: To remove hashes individually, click the Remove button.
segment.target: To remove hashes individually, click the Remove button.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Name page, either accept the automatically generated rule name or type a new rule name, and then click Create.
segment.target: On the Name page, either accept the automatically generated rule name or type a new rule name, and then click Create.
